description:
Your task is to implement a Python function named edit_task() that will allow the user to edit an existing task in the task_list. The function should:

  • Search for a task by title (or task ID, depending on your design).
  • If the task is found, update its attributes such as title, description, priority, deadline, or status based on the provided arguments.
  • If the task is not found, return an error message.

Use the following template to implement the edit_task() function.
code_stub:
def edit_task(task_list, task_id, title=None, description=None, priority=None, deadline=None, completed=None):
    # Find task by title or ID
    pass

    # Update task attributes
    pass
correct_code:
def edit_task(task_list, task_id, title=None, description=None, priority=None, deadline=None, completed=None):
    task = next((t for t in task_list if t.title == task_id), None)  # Find task by title
    if not task:
        print(f"Error: Task with title '{task_id}' not found!")
        return None

    if title:
        task.title = title
    if description:
        task.description = description
    if priority:
        task.priority = priority
    if deadline:
        task.deadline = deadline
    if completed is not None:
        task.completed = completed

    return task
expected_output:
Task with title 'Complete Homework' has been updated.
Error: Task with title 'NonExistentTask' not found!
